abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Telecommunications
            Project for Benin were as follows: the overall project
            outcome is satisfactory. The project exceeded some of its
            physical objectives and achieved most of the institutional
            and financial objectives. GOB first requested the assistance
            of IDA to finance investment in 1982 of the
            telecommunications sector. Further to the work of two
            reconnaissance missions, IDA produced a sector report in
            1983. The report concluded that the current state of
            telecommunications is what constituted a major bottleneck to
            economic development, and that OPTB was ineffective due to
            manpower, organizational and financial constraints. OPTB was
            the Borrower and the Government the Guarantor. With respect
            to the achievement of physical objectives, OPTB performance
            appears highly satisfactory, particularly considering the
            lack of previous experience in managing a large development
            project. Some lessons learned included:  the full
            realization of the institutional objectives of the project
            will have required the involvement of the Government
            authorities in a more active way during project preparation
            and supervision, particularly in the field of staff statute
            and Government arrears for telecommunications services; and
            in-depth sector reorganization and reform of public
            utilities type sectors traditionally operated in a
            monopolistic environment, such as posts and telecoms, is a
            difficult, complex and slow process. The dialogue and
            consultation process initiated under the project between the
            interested parties, Government of Benin (GOB) authorities
            and the donors should be continued, including IDA
            involvement, to encourage and support further restructuring
            and determine ways and means to implement the needed changes.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Telecommunications Project for Benin
            comprises:  (i) the 1988-92 investment program, which is the
            first phase of the medium term development strategy, and
            (ii) the action plan for management and institutional
            improvement in the sector.  The main components include:
            (a) training and technical assistance for institutional
            networks in Cotonou and Porto Novo to meet demand to the
            year 2000, i.e., 34,000 lines; and (c) replacement and
            extension of switching capacity in Contonou and Porto Novo
            and the interchange network.  Also included will be the
            rehabilitation and selected upgrading of the trunk
            transmission network; and finally (e) installation of
            multi-access systems for rural telecommunications.
